lead_paragraph: Guarantee games, in which the visiting team receives hundreds of thousands of dollars to absorb a beating, have many critics, but some in the small-college world defend them.

headline.print_headline: For a College Football Payday, the Collateral Cost Can Hurt
headline.main: Historically Black Schools Pay the Price for a Football Paycheck

snippet: Guarantee games, in which the visiting team receives hundreds of thousands of dollars to absorb a beating, have many critics, but some in the small-college world defend them....
abstract: Joe Nocera Sports Business column raises concerns about so-called guarantee games, where weak university football teams are paid to play against much stronger competitors; focuses on games pitting teams of historically black colleges and universities against football powerhouses, noting that smaller universities play games to fund their athletic departments, despite risk of injury and humiliation for their players.
